titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Bender Collection on Students for a Democratic Society TAM.409
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.unittitle: Robert Bender Collection on Students for a Democratic Society

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Robert Bender was a member of Students for a Democratic Society. He was a political activist in Newark, NJ, in his early years, and served for two years (1962-1964) as Executive Director of New Jersey Americans for Democratic Action. During his tenure at ADA he guided the organization toward ever-deeper involvement in the civil rights movement. This collection of papers pertains mainly to the Students for a Democratic Society, nationally and in Newark, NJ. Included are reports, publications, publicity flyers, correspondence from the 1960s, and a small amount of material dealing with political action in New Jersey in general.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Bender was a member of Students for a Democratic Society. He was a political activist in Newark, NJ, in his early years, and served for two years (1962-1964) as Executive Director of New Jersey Americans for Democratic Action. During his tenure at ADA he guided the organization toward ever-deeper involvement in the civil rights movement. He stepped down in 1964 to pursue a Masters degree at Rutgers University's Labor-Management Institute. He went on to be associated professionally with a number of labor and political organizations in New Jersey, and was a member of the Solidarity Singers and New Jersey Peace Action, among other groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection of papers pertains mainly to the Students for a Democratic Society, nationally and in Newark, NJ. Included are reports, publications, publicity flyers, correspondence from the 1960s, and a small amount of material dealing with political action in New Jersey in general.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Robert Bender sent a gift of materials related to Students for a Democratic Society in 2007. The accession number associated with this gift is 2007.024.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Robert Bender are held by Robert Bender. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Robert Bender.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Robert Bender Collection on Students for a Democratic Society; TAM 409; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
